tool.name: Search GUI
tool.description: Perform protein identification using various search engines and prepare results for input to Peptide Shaker

param.name: input_database
param.label: Protein Database
param.help: Select FASTA database from history

param.name: create_decoy
param.label: Create a concatenated target/decoy database before running PeptideShaker
param.help: Selecting this option will help PeptideShaker calculate FDR values

param.name: use_gene_mapping
param.label: gene mappings will be used and saved along with the project (UniProt databases only)
param.help: This should only be enabled for UniProt databaases

param.name: update_gene_mapping
param.label: Update gene mappings automatically from Ensembl (UniProt databases only)
param.help: This should only be enabled for UniProt databaases

param.name: peak_lists
param.label: Input Peak Lists (mgf)
param.help: Select appropriate MGF dataset(s) from history

param.name: engines
param.label: DB-Search Engines
param.help: Comet and Tide shouldn't both be selected since they use a similar algoritm.

validator.message: Please select at least one output file

tool.help:
**What it does**
Runs multiple search engines on any number of MGF peak lists using the SearchGUI. Default: X! Tandem, OMSSA and MS-GF+ are executed. Optional: MyriMatch, MS-Amanda, Comet and Tide can be executed.
